intro: Meibomia neomexicana, commonly known as the New Mexico meibomia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white, and it has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Meibomia neomexicana is adapted to arid environments and is an important plant in its native ecosystem.
